snippet: Major league teams are embracing the shift on defense as never before, and it is radically reshaping how the infield looks and plays.
abstract: Major league baseball teams are embracing the shift on defense as never before, reshaping way old game is played, and even way it looks; teams, armed with evidence that shows how batter has propensity to hit ball to certain parts of the field, will position their infielders accordingly--at times taking them far from their traditional spots.

byline.contributor: Jorge Arangure Jr. and Pat Borzi contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Major league teams are embracing the shift on defense as never before, and it is radically reshaping how the infield looks and plays.

headline.main: Who’s on Third? In Baseball’s Shifting Defenses, Maybe Nobody
headline.print_headline: Who’s on Third? In Baseball’s Shifting Defenses, Maybe Nobody
